title: Peanut Butter Banana Protein Oatmeal Squares
description: A delicious and nutritious snack, perfect for post-workout or a healthy treat, packed with protein and the goodness of bananas and oats.
method: Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Prepare a 9x13-inch baking dish by spraying well with nonstick cooking spray.
Mix the wet ingredients (milk through flaxseed) together in a large bowl. Stir in the dry ingredients (oats, protein powder, powdered peanut butter, and spices) and mix until combined.
Spoon the oat batter into the prepared baking dish. Bake for 25-28 minutes or until the center is just set and the edges are a light golden brown.

Cool the baking dish on a cooling rack until room temperature. Drizzle with peanut butter (if your peanut butter is very thick, warm in the microwave for 30 seconds before drizzling). Slice into 12 squares.
Serve warm, topped with banana slices or chopped nuts if desired (macros for additional toppings not included).
notes: This recipe is freezer friendly - freeze the squares in a freezer-safe zip-top bag for up to 3 months. Defrost individual squares in the microwave for 30-60 seconds on medium power.

You could also try other flavors of Optimum Nutrition Gold Standard 100% Whey protein powder in this recipe. Chocolate, mocha cappuccino, chocolate peanut butter, or salted caramel would be particularly delicious!

title: Chocolate Protein Blender Muffins
description: A delicious, protein-packed chocolate muffin made with healthy ingredients, perfect for breakfast or a quick snack.
ingredients: 2 scoops Double Rich Chocolate Gold Standard 100% Whey Protein powder
method: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Line a muffin tin with muffin liners.
Combine all ingredients in a high-speed blender until smooth and creamy. Fill muffin liners 3/4 full.
Bake for 25 minutes until the top has puffed up and a toothpick inserted comes out clean.
Allow cooling for 10 minutes before removing from muffin tin.

title: Double Chocolate Protein Oatmeal
description: A rich and hearty chocolate oatmeal recipe packed with protein for a delicious start to your day.
ingredients: ½ - 1 scoop Double Rich Chocolate Gold Standard 100% Whey Protein powder
method: In a medium saucepan, combine all ingredients. Stir well to combine. Bring mixture to a low boil, then cook for 3-4 minutes until desired consistency. Add 1-2 tbsp of maple syrup for extra sweetness if desired.
Serve oatmeal with sliced banana and peanut butter.

title: Gold Standard 100% Whey Peanut Butter Cups
description: Delicious and protein-packed peanut butter cups made with Gold Standard 100% Whey for a perfect treat.
ingredients: 2 scoops Gold Standard 100% Whey – Vanilla Ice Cream
method: Melt chocolate chips and coconut oil in a microwave-safe bowl in 30-second intervals, stirring in between, until smooth.
Line a muffin tin with liners and pour 1-2 teaspoons of melted chocolate into each liner, spreading it to cover the bottom. Place in the freezer for 10 minutes.
Mix peanut butter and Gold Standard 100% Whey in a separate bowl until smooth. Add a small spoonful of the peanut butter mixture on top of the frozen chocolate base and spread it evenly.
Pour another 1-2 teaspoons of melted chocolate on top of the peanut butter layer, spreading to cover.
Freeze the cups for another 10-15 minutes or until set. Store in the refrigerator.
notes: Customize by adding a sprinkle of sea salt on top for a sweet and salty treat.
You can use dark chocolate for a richer flavor or milk chocolate for a sweeter option.

title: 100% Whey Strawberry Banana Protein Smoothie Bowl
description: A refreshing and healthy smoothie bowl packed with protein, perfect for a quick breakfast or snack.
ingredients: 1 scoop Gold Standard 100% Whey, Banana Cream
method: Blend all ingredients in a blender until smooth.
Pour into a bowl and serve.

title: Amino Energy Ice Pops
description: Refreshing and energizing ice pops, perfect for cooling down on a hot day while getting your daily amino energy boost.
method: Mix Amino Energy powder with water until fully dissolved.
Pour the mixture into ice pop molds.
Add optional fruit slices into the molds for garnish.
Freeze for at least 2 hours or until fully set.
notes: Experiment with different Amino Energy flavors to create a variety of refreshing pops.
Great for post-workout or as a mid-day treat.

title: Amino Energy Green Apple Gummies
description: Delicious and energizing green apple-flavored gummies made with Amino Energy, perfect for a quick boost.
ingredients: 2 scoops Amino Energy Green Apple flavor
method: In a shaker cup, mix 1 cup water, 2 scoops of Amino Energy Green Apple flavor, and 4 packets of unflavored unsweetened gelatin.
Pour the mixture into a skillet and place over low heat, stirring frequently, until particles dissolve.
Pour into a mold of your choice; an ice cube tray works well.
Chill in the fridge for at least 1 hour.
notes: Use other ON Amino Energy flavors to make your own creations.

title: Avocado Casein Protein Truffle Balls
description: Rich, creamy, and protein-packed truffle balls made with avocado and casein protein for a guilt-free treat.
method: Mash the avocado in a mixing bowl until smooth.
Add the casein protein powder, cocoa powder, honey, and almond flour to the bowl. Mix until a dough forms.
Roll the dough into small balls, about 1 inch in diameter.
If desired, roll the truffle balls in shredded coconut to coat.
Chill in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour before serving.
notes: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.
Try using different flavors of casein protein to create unique variations.

title: 100% Casein Matcha Nice Cream
description: A creamy and delicious nice cream made with matcha and casein protein, perfect for a healthy dessert or post-workout treat.
method: Blend frozen bananas and vanilla extract well in a food processor.
Add xantham gum, stevia, matcha powder, and Casein to the food processor and mix until well combined.
Place in freezer for about 5 minutes, then serve.
notes: Enjoy with fresh fruit or a waffle cone for extra indulgence.
For a richer flavor, experiment with other protein powder flavors.

title: HydroWhey Protein Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: Soft and chewy chocolate chip cookies made with HydroWhey for a protein-packed treat.
method: Mix together almond flour, chocolate chips, HydroWhey, stevia, baking soda, and salt in a bowl.
Add in coconut oil, oat milk, and vanilla extract and combine.
Once you have dough, form into balls that are about a 2 Tbsp portion.
Flatten dough on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Bake at 180°C for 8-10 minutes until golden brown.
Cool before serving.
notes: Add extra chocolate chips on top for decoration before baking.
Store cookies in an airtight container for up to a week.

title: HydroWhey Protein Blueberry Pancakes
description: Fluffy and protein-rich pancakes made with HydroWhey, perfect for breakfast or a post-workout treat.
method: Mix together all ingredients in a bowl until silky smooth.
Place a portion of the mixture on the pan to cook.
Cook each pancake about 1-2 minutes on each side.
notes: Top pancakes with additional fresh blueberries or a drizzle of honey for extra sweetness.
Serve warm with a side of Greek yogurt for added protein.
